intro: Tracheliopsis tauricum, commonly known as the Tauric tracheliopsis, is a rare and lesser-known plant species native to the Taurus Mountains in Turkey. It is a small, herbaceous plant with delicate, grass-like leaves that are typically narrow and linear. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish or pale yellow in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
